question.xref: DES s6, HC r130, HC p114, KYTS p64
question.text: What is the reason for the area marked in red and white along the centre of this road?

explanation.text: Areas of ‘hatched markings’ such as these are to separate traffic streams which could be a danger to each other. They are often seen on bends or where the road becomes narrow. If the area is bordered by a solid white line, you must not enter it except in an emergency.

answer.text: It is to separate traffic flowing in opposite directions
It marks an area to be used by overtaking motorcyclists
It is a temporary marking to warn of the roadworks
It is separating the two sides of the dual carriageway
